Broken_Arrow.Union Multipurpose Activity Center: The Union Multipurpose Activity Center (also known as the UMAC or John Q. Hammons Arena) is a 5,662-seat multipurpose arena located in Tulsa, Oklahoma. Built in 2003 at a cost of $22 million, it is the home of the Union High School Redskins basketball team. It hosted The Summit League's men’s basketball tournament from 2005 to 2008.
